text.p: CS Research recommends overweighting Swiss medical technology firm Stratec Holding Ltd in a model share portfolio.

"In first half 1996 Stratec achieved excellent results. On gratifying 20 percent sales growth, the operating result and net income were raised disproportionately by 38 percent and 41 percent, respectively," analyst Urs Kunz wrote.
CS said it expected marked sales growth in the second half, and outsize increases in operating and net income.
It raised its earnings estimate for the full year 1996 to 35.5 million Swiss francs from 31.5 million.
It also noted that Stratec's premium to the Swiss equity market is less than 10 percent on a price/earnings (p/e) basis forecast for 1997.
CS forecast Stratec's p/e ratio at 19.9 for 1996, and 16.5 for 1997. It said the 1995 p/e ratio was 26.1
CS also said it was raising its 12-month price target to 1,400 Swiss francs from 1,230 Swiss francs.
Stratec registered shares were quoted Monday afternoon on the Swiss Electronic Bourse at 1,250, up one franc.
